link.Abstract: Enter for your chance to win the ultimate Juno Awards experience.
link.title: Dose.ca's Juno Contest

content.div:
The Shat has company. A new slate of Juno Awards performers was announced today, so look for nominees Hey Rosetta!, Alyssa Reid, Anjulie, Dragonette, JRDN and Mia Martina when the show is broadcast live from Ottawa Sunday, April 1. Those acts will join host William Shatner -- along with previously announced performers Blue Rodeo, City and Colour, deadmau5, Feist, Hedley, Sarah McLachlan and Nickelback -- on Canadian music's big night.

Further performers are expected to be revealed in the coming weeks, and if 12 acts and counting seems excessive to any of you awards show-watchers with early bedtimes, know this:

Just-announced performers Alyssa Reid, Anjulie, Dragonette, JRDN and Mia Martina are expected to collaborate on one big number, a bit being described in a press release as a "live dance 'mixed tape' performance" -- which we're really hoping will actually be a tribute to one of Canada's great musical traditions, the MuchMusic DanceMix compilations of the early '90s. (Never forget.)

The 2012 Juno Awards will air on CTV Sunday, April 1. (We’re 75 per cent sure Master T will not be there.)

(Check out more on this year's Juno Awards nominees.)

leahc@dose.ca

link.title: Feist, City and Colour, deadmau5, Blue Rodeo Playing 2012 Juno Awards

link.Abstract: The 2012 Juno Awards will take place in Ottawa.
link.title: Juno Awards Coming to Ottawa in 2012; Does This Mean We'll Get a Stephen Harper/Justin Bieber Duet?

link.Abstract: Check out the highlights -- and lowlights -- from the 2011 Juno Awards, which took place in Toronto on March 27, 2011.
link.title: Juno Awards 2011: Best and Worst Moments

link.Abstract: The stars braved the cold on the Juno red carpet. Check out their styles and use the stars below each photo to rate the look.
link.title: Juno Awards 2011: Rate the Fashions

link.Abstract: Neil Young, Shad and Karkwa took home early Juno Awards in the non-televised gala Saturday night in Toronto. See who else brought home a trophy.
link.title: Neil Young, Shad, Karkwa Among Early Juno Winners

link.Abstract: Watch "The Bad in Each Other," the latest video from Feist.
link.title: Feist Premieres New Video, Makes You Feel Feelings

link.Abstract: On the eve of his Canadian tour, City and Colour's Dallas Green chats about how plumbing personal troubles for his music has struck a chord with fans.
link.title: Interview: City and Colour Helping Fans Cope With Their Own 'Little Hells'

link.Abstract: Frontman Jacob Hoggard laughs off talk that the band is maturing and insists they've always written introspective ballads.
link.title: Hedley talks about growing up

link.Abstract: Photos: Feist in Toronto
link.title: Photos: Feist in Toronto

link.Abstract: The day after ringing in 2012 in New York's Times Square, Drake jetted to Las Vegas to play a set at The Joint/Hard Rock Hotel & Casino. YOLO, right? We've got photos from the Jan. 1 show.
link.title: Photos: Drake Takes Care of Las Vegas

entry.content: City and Colour, Dan Mangan, Drake, Feist, Hedley and Nickelback are the top Juno nominees for 2012.

link.Abstract: Feist performs in Ottawa Dec. 5, 2011. The Metals singer-songwriter will return to the city to play the 2012 Juno Awards April 1.
link.title: Feist

link.Abstract: Photos: Feist in Toronto
link.title: Photos: Feist in Toronto

link.Abstract: Where was "1,2,3,4?" Feist's concert at Toronto's Massey Hall may have challenged some fans, but to the rest, there's no limit to their love of all things Leslie Feist.
link.title: Concert Review: Feist in Toronto (Dec. 1, 2011)

link.Abstract: Feist's new video for "How Come You Never Go There" is out. Watch it here.
link.title: Watch Feist's New Video (So That's What She Was Up To On Her Break...)

link.Abstract: Listen up! We've got reviews of new music from Adam & The Amethysts, DJ Shadow, Feist, Lights and Zola Jesus.
link.title: Album Reviews (Feist, Adam & the Amethysts, Lights and More)

link.Abstract: Feist is back with Metals. The singer-songwriter chats about that new record and the much-needed breather she took before getting it done.
link.title: Interview: Feist Comes Out of Self-Imposed Exile

link.Abstract: Get the latest music news, interviews and album reviews
link.title: Get the latest music news, interviews and album reviews

link.Abstract: Drake was several hours late for his Sundance Festival set Jan. 21, but the Take Care rapper had an excuse. A snowstorm. "I almost lost my life six times to get to this motherf*cker," he told the crowd. "My flight was delayed six hours." Well, OK then. Check out photos from his show.
link.title: Photos: Drake Does Sundance

entry.content: With 4 nominations, Drake is one of the top contenders at the 2012 Juno Awards. Check out photos and 4 Fast Facts about the Toronto-raised hip-hop superstar. The Juno Awards will be broadcast on CTV Sunday, April 1.
